TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, Dman979 said:
> 
> 
> No, there is no ASL subforum. I included it as a joke, because most of the other moderators speak a second language other than English, and I felt left out. ![:/](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/ZNGIcon1.png ":/") Seeing as it's caused a bit of confusion, I'll change my title. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(")
> 

Oh no... don't do it because of me. I'm the outlier. Joke is good joke. 

Granted if I fail to pass my medical and I enter VG development; I'll learn Spanish. So there's that.
Which mod runs the Kerbal facebook page? they made a 420 joke and I've received infractions for less here lol.

> 
>

> 
> 
> Which mod runs the Kerbal facebook page? they made a 420 joke and I've received infractions for less here lol.

None of the mods are involved in that, it's run by Squad staff.
Which mod is the oldest?

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, Core said:
> 
> 
> Which mod is the oldest?
> 

If by been on the team the longest, I think it might be Supernovy or myself. If by age... well I'll let them answer that :p.

EDIT: Forgot about Purpletarget and SJWT, they were here before me.
question for the mods: would it be possible to impose a max character count per post to prevent people from pasting multi-megabyte logs into posts (it causes all sorts of problems)?

> 
> 
> 13 minutes ago, TheRagingIrishman said:
> 
> 
> question for the mods: would it be possible to impose a max character count per post to prevent people from pasting multi-megabyte logs into posts (it causes all sorts of problems)?
> 

Not supported by the software or any plugin I could find for it, unfortunately. I agree this would be a good addition.

That might create some unintended consequences for the Fan Works/Mission Reports section of the forums. 

**Edited <time datetime="2017-05-30T16:00:32Z" title="05/30/2017 04:00  PM" data-short="7 yr">May 30, 2017</time> by Ten Key**

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, Red Iron Crown said:
> 
> 
> Not supported by the software or any plugin I could find for it, unfortunately. I agree this would be a good addition.
> 

[Please no](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/155960-community-mods-and-plugins-library-continued-for-122-13/&page=1).

We would just have to set an appropriate limit. It's someone pasting in a 50MB log and the forum slowing to a crawl that we want to prevent, not an amount of text maintainable by a human. 

It's hypothetical at this point anyway.

I'm not quite sure whether anyone else has noticed this, but where has our (as members, not devs) ability gone for being able to post articles? This used to be quite a thing (for me) in the pre-2015 forum update, and since then I can't find any information on people talking about the disappearance of regular members being able to post articles. Any information or reasoning regarding this? Thanks ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

So uh, (Stupid mobile) I've accidentally marked both addon releases and space/sci as read, the s/s threads was a few weeks ago, is there any way to change that back? ![:/](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/ZNGIcon1.png ":/")

I've got a problem with the forum and not sure where to direct it. Here lately (for the past three weeks), whenever I do a forum search, it will go to a blank screen. That's it. No search results, no nothin'. It's making it very hard to do anything on the forum, especially updating mods. Any suggestions...?

> 
> 
> 5 minutes ago, adsii1970 said:
> 
> 
> It's making it very hard to do anything on the forum, **especially updating mods**. Any suggestions...?
> 

<abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>.

> 
> 
> 6 minutes ago, ZooNamedGames said:
> 
> 
> <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>.
> 

Not a direct attack against you, [@ZooNamedGames](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/103726-zoonamedgames/), but there are a few dozen mods I use whose authors refuse to use <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>. And after a series of problems I had a while back ago with <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>, I prefer to update the mods myself. I do not like <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>. I do not like <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>, Sam I am...!

And the problem is the forum misdirecting and not my abilities to update mods on my own.
